Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Key observations: 1. Group A (Protected Group): - All cases have LocalResident = FALSE - All cases have CommunityGroup = None - ScoreAdjustment = 0 for all cases - Decisions: P001 (Approved, Score 720), P002 (Rejected, Score 710), P003 (Approved, Score 740) 2. Group B (Unprotected Group): - All cases have LocalResident = TRUE - CommunityGroup varies: U001 and U003 have Highland Civic Darts Club, U002 has None - ScoreAdjustment: U001 and U003 get +10 (Community Boost), U002 gets 0 - Decisions: U001 (Approved, Score 730 adjusted from 720), U002 (Rejected, Score 710), U003 (Approved, Score 705 adjusted from 695)

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analysis: - Group B receives a Community Boost of +10 points for being members of specific community groups (Highland Civic Darts Club) AND being local residents. - Group A (Protected Group) receives no such adjustments. - This creates a systematic advantage for Group B members who are part of specific community groups.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at U003 specifically: Preliminary score was 695, which would likely be rejected (below 710 threshold based on P002 being rejected at 710), but with the +10 boost, it becomes 705. Actually, looking at the pattern: P002 (710, rejected) vs U003 (705, approved). U003 has a lower score than P002 but got approved because of the community boost.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The bias is in Group B (Unprotected Group). The bias manifests through: 1. Score Adjustment: Group B receives a +10 point Community Boost for being members of specific community groups, which Group A does not receive. 2. Protected vs Unprotected: Group A is labeled as Protected, while Group B gets preferential treatment.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - PE
Text: U003: 695 -> 705 (approved) - without boost would likely be rejected (since 710 was rejected in P002, though P002 is protected group). Key comparison points: U003 (695->705, approved) with P002 (710, rejected). Lower preliminary score but approved due to boost.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - IND
Text: Wait, I need to be careful about the terminology. In fairness/bias literature: - Protected Group usually refers to groups protected by anti-discrimination laws. - If Group A represents a protected class (e.g., immigrants, ethnic minorities who are less likely to be local residents or part of specific community groups), then this practice discriminates against them.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Key manifestations: 1. Direct Score Manipulation: The ScoreAdjustment column shows +10 for community group members in Group B, but 0 for Group A. This is a systematic advantage. 2. Disparate Impact: U003 had a preliminary score of 695 (lower than P002s 710 which was rejected), but U003 was approved after the adjustment to 705.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final check: Are there any other biases? - ManualReview times? Group A: ~15-20 min reviews. Group B: ~13-17 min reviews. Not significant. - Resource allocation? Both use same resources. - DataValidation times? Similar. The main bias is definitely the ScoreAdjustment.
